nip.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to go somewhere quickly or for a short time
nip.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Have we time to nip down the pub for a quick drink?
Another car nipped in  (=moved quickly into a space) in front of me.
Iâ€™ve got to nip home and change my clothes.
nip.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to bite someone or something lightly
nip.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: She gently nipped the lobe of his ear.
The fish swam all around her and nipped at her legs.
nip.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: to suddenly and quickly press something tightly between two fingers, edges, or surfaces
nip.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Sally nipped her cheeks to make them look less pale.
He nipped his finger in the door.
nip.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: if cold weather or the wind nips at part of your body or at a plant, it hurts or damages it
nip.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: The frost nipped at our fingers.
nip.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: the act or result of biting something lightly or pressing something between two fingers, edges, or surfaces
nip.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: His dog gave me a painful nip on the leg.
nip.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: a small amount of strong alcoholic drink
